result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luciano Mata III

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] cases #21CF431, #21CF449, #21CT423, #21CT455, #22CF204 called at 2:48pm 
Defendant Luciano Mata III in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer. ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Fischer received an offer from ADA Shock on the most recent of the CF cases. Attorney Fischer indicates that further time is needed to work toward a global resolution of the cases
The Court recesses at 2:50pm, directing the parties to discuss the matters.
reconvene 3:08pm  
The Defense has now provided a counter-proposal to the State. Due to the volume of the cases, ADA Shock needs to go through the cases in relation to the proposal.  Attorney Fischer requests that the OWI 3rd case [#21CT455 ] be scheduled later this week.  
ADA Shock indicates that he wishes to have the OWI 3rd case proceed to trial as scheduled next week.  
Thereafter the Court informs the parties that the jury trial set next week in #21CT455 will likely be bumped.
The Court grants the Defense request for adjournment. The Court removes the #21CT455 trial date from its calendar. 
recess 3:12pm.

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing in case #21CT455 and Status Conference in the other cases (possible global resolution on all cases) -- all on November 28th at 2:00pm

[ma] Case called at 2:36pm 
Defendant Luciano Mata III in court.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Luciano Mata III.  Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
WCS Representative, Jonathan Reinke appears via telephone. 

The Court addresses outstanding SCRAM Fees: 
--Mr. Reinke indicates a $100 payment has been made; urges Mr. Mata to be more consistent about payments
--The Court takes no action at this time
--The Court directs Mr. Reinke to submit letter prior to next hearing on Mr. Mata's compliance with SCRAM payment and downloads

Atty Fischer anticipates resolution. 
recess: 2:42pm
Set for hearing
Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
SCRAM Failure to pay.

Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ml] Cases 21CF431, 21CF449, 21CT423, 21CT455, and 22CF204 called at 8:48AM
Defendant Luciano Mata III in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to file 22CF204:
Mr. Mata waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all Counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

The State requests that file 21CT455 be set for Final Status and Trial, with all other files to track along for Status.

recess 8:55AM

NEXT:   
(1) Pretrial Conference on 09/07 at 11:40AM with counsel appearances only
As to 21CT455:
(2) Final Status Conference on 11/01 at 2:30PM (all other files to track along for Status)
(3) Jury Trial on 11/07 at 8:30AM
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 21CT455, 21CF449, 21CT423,21CF431,22CF204 called at 2:24 PM 
Defendant Luciano Mata III in court.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Luciano Mata III.  Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

Atty Fischer indicates that he was recently retained; needs time to review discovery and speak with prosecutor. 

Scheduling is discussed.

recess: 2:27pm
NEXT: As to Case 22CF204, Preliminary Hearing on 8/18/22 at 8:30am 
As to Cases 21CT455, 21CF449, 21CT423,21CF431, Status on 8/18/22 at 8:30am

Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ml] Cases 21CF449, 21CT423, 21CT455, and 22CF204 called at 4:01PM
Defendant Luciano Mata in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att De La Rosa advises that resolution has not been reached, and that he is orally proposing a Motion to Withdraw due to a breakdown in the Attorney/Client relationship.
The Court grants the Defense Motion to Withdraw, removes the Jury Trial from the its calendar, and sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel.

The Court notes that all the State's Pretrial Motions carry over until the next hearing.

recess 4:10PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 017/21 at 2:00PM with in person appearances
Bond Payment and Surety Information
Scheduling Order
Surety Information
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Conditions of this Bond include:
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ml] Case called at 1:55PM
Defendant Luciano Mata appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def declined to be evaluated).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
As the Defendant will be attempting to retain private counsel, the Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits and sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel.

The Court requires a $400.00 Cash Bond with conditions:
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 2:03PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/19 at 3:30PM (to track along with the Defendant's other cases)
